intro: Pogonotrophe sumatrana, commonly known as the Sumatran pogonotrophe, is a flowering plant native to the Indonesian island of Sumatra. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. Its leaves are opposite and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
